message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. I'm confident you'll love it!
I'll take it!
I've got another high-quality product for you. I've sold you one before, and you seemed to like it. This one is just as good, if not better. Would you like to buy it?
I'm not sure I should buy another one without seeing the quality first.

I understand your caution, but I assure you that this one is also a high-quality product. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else for a lower price, and you'll miss out on the opportunity to get it at the full $100. Would you like to take a chance and buy it?
I'm not convinced, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying something that might be low-quality.

I'm offering you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and sell you another high-quality product of your choice for $100. This way, you have nothing to lose and a chance to get a great product. Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not willing to take the risk of buying a potentially low-quality product, even with the promise of a refund and a second chance.

I'm willing to sweeten the deal even further. If you buy this product and it's low-quality, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also give you a $20 bonus on top of that. And, I'll throw in a second high-quality product of your choice for free. You'll get a great product, a refund, and a bonus. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced. The potential loss of $100 is still too great, and I'm not sure I trust the 'free' high-quality product you're offering.

I understand your concerns, and I want to address them directly. I'm willing to take on the risk myself. I'll buy the product from you for $100, and then resell it to me at a markup. If it's low-quality, I'll take the loss. But if it's high-quality, I'll make a profit and you'll get to see that I'm willing to put my own money where my mouth is. Would you like to sell it to me?
I'll sell it to you, but only because I want to see if you'll actually take on the risk yourself.

As promised, I'm buying the product from you at a markup. I'm now willing to offer you the same deal I offered myself. I'll buy this product from you for $100, and then resell it to you at a markup. If it's low-quality, I'll take the loss. If it's high-quality, you'll get to buy it from me at a discount. What do you say?
I don't think I want to play this game with you anymore. I'm not going to fall for the same trick twice.

I completely understand your skepticism. Let me be transparent with you. I've already sold you a high-quality product, and I've taken on the risk myself to prove my commitment. Now, I'm offering you a product that's not as valuable, but still a good deal at $100. It's not a high-quality product, but it's a fair price for what you're getting. Would you like to take it?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, regardless of the price.

I've been transparent about the quality of the previous product, and now I'm offering you a high-quality product. I'm willing to give you a discount on this one, just for you. I'll sell it to you for $90. You've seen that I've been honest about the quality of the previous product, and now you have a chance to get a great deal on a high-quality product. What do you say?
I'll take it, but only because the price is lower and I'm hoping for a high-quality product.

I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a gift card. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

But, if you buy it, I'll also give you a 10% discount on your next purchase, no matter what the quality is. You'll get a great product at a great price, and a chance to save even more in the future.
